intro.speaker: Donnel
intro.line: Halp! You gots to help us! I’m beggin’ you, milords!

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Slow down. What happened?

intro.speaker: Brigand
intro.line: Oy! There’s the wee piglet!

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: ...Great. Bandits.

intro.speaker: Brigand
intro.line: What’s this? A little lording come to watch over his chattel? Haw ha—Aw, damn me! Sh-Shepherds!

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: That’s right. So, what’ll it be? Run and live? Or fight and die?

intro.speaker: Brigand
intro.line: Rrgh!

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Quickly, lad. What happened here?

intro.speaker: Donnel
intro.line: Y-yes, milord! Right away, milord! ...Er, if it please Your Graciousness.

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Maybe just hold off on titles for now. What’s your name?

intro.speaker: Donnel
intro.line: Donny. Er, that is, Donnel. ...Your Majestyful. I live in the village just beyond, sir.

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: I guess that’ll do. Now, what happened?

intro.speaker: Donnel
intro.line: That rotten-toothed, pig-stinkin’ bandit you just ran off attacked us! Er, pardon my language, You Lordliness. I’m the only one what got away, and even then just barely. They were roundin’ up others to haul ‘em off to a bandit camp... Please, sir! You gots to save them folks! My ma’s one of ‘em, and... She’s all I got in this world! Please, Your Royal Highness!

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: This blasted war seems to spawn more evils by the day. All right, Donny. We’ll save your ma. Can you lead us to her?

intro.speaker: Donnel
intro.line: Aw, thank you, milord! Thank you! Just follow me, Your Sirness!

intro.speaker: Roddick
intro.line: ...And you’re sure a’this?

intro.speaker: Brigand
intro.line: On the grave of my sainted mother, I swear it. It was Chrom and his Shepherds, and no mistake!

intro.speaker: Roddick
intro.line: Heh heh heh. A fancy lord’ll fetch a high ransom from noble folk. We’ll have the little man squealin’ for mercy in no time!

intro.speaker: Mother
intro.line: We got nothin’ left to take, sirs! Please, let our children go!

intro.speaker: Roddick
intro.line: Quit yer bleatin’!

intro.speaker: Brigand
intro.line: Oy, Roddick! I think this cow’s the mum of the brat what ran away.

intro.speaker: Roddick
intro.line: ...Say, I know this one. You’re the wife of the man what broke my rib last time we were ‘ere.

intro.speaker: Mother
intro.line: And you killed him for it, monster! I wish he’d done for you first...

intro.speaker: Roddick
intro.line: Small wonder the brat’s got more brass than brains if you’re his mum. Guess we’ll see for ourselves when we catch him, eh? Maybe we’ll even make ya watch as we gut him! Bwa ha ha!

intro.speaker: Mother
intro.line: N-no! Please, he’s just a boy!

intro.speaker: Donnel
intro.line: This here’s where they’ve taken up camp, Your Lordshipness.

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Er...right. Thanks, Donny. Stay close, now.

intro.speaker: Donnel
intro.line: Beg pardon, milord? You don’t mean...? I...I can’t fight, sir! I ain’t never even stuck a pig before!

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Oh, sorry. I just assumed... I mean... Look, just stay here. You’ll be fine.

intro.speaker: Donnel
intro.line: I wish I was strong as you sirs and madams! Kick that scum out single handed, I would!

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Then you should fight and grow stronger.

intro.speaker: Donnel
intro.line: But I ain’t—

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: No man is born a warrior, Donny. And farm work makes for fine training—a sickle’s not far from a sword, after all. Bandits may be tougher than wheat, but the principle’s the same.

intro.speaker: Donnel
intro.line: Ngh... *sniff* A-all right, milord. As you say, I’m no warrior. But these’re my people. I gots to do what I can!

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Everyone in place?

intro.speaker: Donnel
intro.line: R-ready! *ulp*

battle.speaker: Donnel
battle.line: Fight and get stronger, he says... Guess it can’t hurt to try. I sure hope I don’t get in the way! Gosh, that would be just awful...

battle.speaker: Donnel
battle.line: I don’t think I can... go any farther... Your Majestiness...

battle.speaker: Chrom
battle.line: You’ve done enough, Donny! Fall back! We’ll take things from here.

boss.speaker: Roddick
boss.line: Time them castle whelps learned what us wild-born men can do!

end.speaker: Donnel
end.line: We did it! We’re rid of them bandits for good and all!

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: A worthy first victory, Donny. You fought well.

end.speaker: Donnel
end.line: Ma! Ma, it’s me!

end.speaker: Mother
end.line: Oh, Donny! Thank goodness you’re safe! I was worried near to death, boy! I can’t thank you enough for savin’ my son and our village, milord. ...Donny! Where are your manners?! Take a knee and thank His Lordness!

end.speaker: Donnel
end.line: Er, I can’t begin to repay all what you done for us, sir! Th-thank you!

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: You led the charge, Donny. We just picked off the stragglers. Hone your potential and use it to keep this village safe.

end.speaker: Donnel
end.line: W-wait! Please!

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Something wrong?

end.speaker: Donnel
end.line: I has a request, sir. If it please Your Graceliness... Take me with you, milord! Lemme be a Shepherd like you! I’m good with livestock, I am! Please, sir!

end.speaker: Mother
end.line: Hush now, you fool boy!

end.speaker: Donnel
end.line: I want to hone my...whatever he said. I want to keep this place safe! I never thought I was good for nothin’ more than shovelin’ dirt... But milord showed me there’s more I can do. More I needs to be doing!

end.speaker: Mother
end.line: You needs be knowin’ your place, boy! A farmhand’s no fit for a royal—

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Actually, we’d be thrilled to have him. The Shepherds need every good man we can find, and your son fought bravely.

end.speaker: Mother
end.line: Y-you’re very kind to say as much, Your Lordshipness, but... *Siiigh* Well, you’re a man grown now, Donny. I s’pose you can make up your own mind.

end.speaker: Donnel
end.line: Aw, Ma...

end.speaker: Mother
end.line: ...... You just come home safe, love. I’ll see that the village is still standin’ when you return a hero. ...Well?! Off with you, then! Glory’s waiting’, boy!

end.speaker: Donnel
end.line: I ain’t fightin’ for glory, Ma. I’m fightin’ for you! But if I do find some glory, I’ll be sure to bring it home for you!

end.speaker: Mother
end.line: ...Just come home alive, Donny.

end.speaker: Donnel
end.line: Ma! Ma, it’s me!

end.speaker: Mother
end.line: Oh, Donny! Thank goodness you’re safe! I was worried near to death, boy! I can’t thank you enough for savin’ my son and our village, milord. ...Donny! Where are your manners?! Take a knee and thank His Lordness!

end.speaker: Donnel
end.line: Er, I can’t begin to repay all what you done for us, sir! Th-thank you!

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: You did enough, Donny. And you’re young yet. In time, you’ll be defending this village single handedly.

end.speaker: Donnel
end.line: Still, I... I’m sorry I wasn’t more help, Your Princeliness.
